headline: 2,000 drivers left UPS after taking buyouts, analyst says
summary: About 2,000 unionized delivery drivers accepted a buyout offer from UPS in the third quarter, according to an estimate by Satish Jindel, a long-time parcel shipping consultant and president of ShipMatrix. UPS CEO Carol Tomé said during Tuesday’s earnings briefing that the buyouts will cost the company $175 million. The Atlanta-based parcel logistics giant has […] The post 2,000 drivers left UPS after taking buyouts, analyst says appeared first on FreightWaves.

headline: Payroll Processors Continue to Slide. What the Charts of Paylocity Holding, Paycom Software Say.
summary: Employment-related news may be sending an early warning that the labor market is losing steam, a precursor to a recession.  Meta Platforms Amazon,  Microsoft Intel Corp United Parcel Service Applied Materials, and Target are just some of the names disclosing job cuts in recent weeks.  Shares of payroll processors, staffing firms, and the like—companies that often lead employment trends—have begun to weaken.

headline: Amazon Job Cuts Broaden Big Tech’s Layoff Barrage
summary: When layoffs rise, people spend less, which leads to tighter bottom lines and more layoffs. Wash, rinse, and repeat.

headline: UPS (UPS) Net Margin Miss Reinforces Investor Concern Over Dividend and Financial Strength
summary: United Parcel Service (UPS) reported that its net profit margin slipped slightly to 6.1%, down from last year's 6.2%. Over the last five years, the company's earnings have decreased by 2.1% annually and most recently, UPS posted negative earnings growth. Looking ahead, analysts project earnings growth at 7.6% per year and revenue growing at 2% annually. Both forecasts trail the broader US market pace. See our full analysis for United Parcel Service. Next up, we will see how these results line...
